thread.title: 'Auring' changes direction, moves toward Surigao del Norte
thread.title_full: 'Auring' changes direction, moves toward Surigao del Norte

title: 'Auring' changes direction, moves toward Surigao del Norte

organizations.name: philippine atmospheric, geophysical and astronomical services administration

text: Nation ( Leaderboard Top ), pagematch: 1, sectionmatch: 1 'Auring' changes direction, moves toward Surigao del Norte (philstar.com) | Updated January 8, 2017 - 11:30am Track of Tropical Depression Auring as of 11 a.m. on Sunday, January 8, 2017. PAGASA MANILA, Philippines (UPDATE 1 2:20 p.m.) â€” Tropical Depression Auring has changed speed and direction and is now moving towards Surigao del Norte. At 1 p.m. on Sunday, the center of "Auring" was estimated at 80 km north-northeast of Hinatuan, Surigao del Sur, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) said in its 2 p.m. severe weather bulletin. It is forecast to move northwest at 9 kph. "Auring" is packing maximum winds of up to 55 kph near the center and gustiness of up to 70 kph. PAGASA said the tropical depression is expected to bring an estimated moderate to heavy rainfall amount within its 300 km diameter. The state weather bureau warned residents in areas with Tropical Cyclone Warning Signal (TCWS) Number 1 and over the rest of Eastern and Central Visayas against possible flashfloods and landslides. Fisherfolks and those with small seacrafts were also advised not to venture out over the eastern seaboard of Visayas and Mindanao. The tropical depression is expected to make landfall over Surigao del Sur between Sunday evening and Monday early morning. TCWS
